subject: Re: [junit] What is the error?
msgSnippet: The answer is contained in this line, read carefully: . Test.java:3: class MoneyTest is public, should be declared in a file named MoneyTest.java -- ***Cédric
messageBody:
The answer is contained in this line, read carefully:

.\Test.java:3: class MoneyTest is public, should be declared in a file named
MoneyTest.java

--
***Cédric
*



On Tue, Oct 21, 2008 at 12:29 PM, Varuna Seneviratna <
varunaseneviratna@...> wrote:

> *I have these two classes in the same directory* *JunitTest*
>
> > public class Money{
> >
> > private int amount;
> > private String currency;
> >
> > public Money(int amount,String currency){
> > this.amount=amount;
> > this.currency=currency;
> >
> >
> > }
> > public Money add(Money m){
> >
> > int total=m.amount+this.amount;
> > Money newMoney=new Money(total, m.currency);
> > return newMoney;
> >
> > }
> >
> >
> > }
>
> import org.junit.*;
> >
> > public class MoneyTest{
> > @Test
> > public void simpleAdd() {
> > Money m12CHF= new Money(12, "CHF");
> > Money m14CHF= new Money(14, "CHF");
> > Money expected= new Money(26, "CHF");
> > Money result= m12CHF.add(m14CHF);
> > Assert.assertTrue(expected.equals(result));
> > }
> >
> >
> >
> > }
> >
>
> *I have set the classpath to the C:\Junit\junit4.5\junit-4.5.jar
> When I try to compile MoneyTest.java from within the JunitTest Directory I
> get the below result*
> *I have saved the MoneyTest.java in a MoneyTest.java file*
> -- C:\JunitTest>javac MoneyTest.java
> .\Test.java:3: class MoneyTest is public, should be declared in a file
> named
> Mon
> eyTest.java
> public class MoneyTest{
> ^
> MoneyTest.java:4: cannot access Test
> bad class file: .\Test.java
> file does not contain class Test
> Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of the
> classpa
> th.
> @Test
> ^
>
> Help!!!!!!!!!
>
> Varuna
